story.text: Here’s every single rated attraction in the United States, from the Seven Stars Alpaca Ranch (the #1 thing to do in Coeur D’Alene) to the Balch Institute of Ethnic Studies of the Historical Society of Pennsylvania (1 review; 5 stars), to the Heaviest Corner on Earth (Birmingham, AL). That’s 80,197 “things to do,” according to Trip Advisor.
The size of the circle indicates the number of reviews an attraction’s received.

Indeed, what New Yorker hasn’t marvelled at the sights of... the Statue of Liberty? Or strolled blissfully through… Times Square? But I admit, I’m being facetious. Most New Yorkers have never made a pilgrimage to Lady Liberty, and many have little love for Times Square.

No one ever aims to “travel like a tourist.” Sure, we want to see the sights at the Grand Canyon, but big ticket attractions aside, we invariably strive to visit the same hidden gems that the locals frequent and love. Let’s remove the sites whose reviews came from a majority (60%+) of visitors who live fewer than 60 miles/100km away.
Better! But let’s face it, no one wants to go to the worst-reviewed park in New York City (unless you’re these folks). Let’s color code these from cold fish to hot tamale
